entry.content:
You are at war within yourself because you are not living your truth. The war is between your conscience and your conscious. The feelings of the conscience speak the power of  truth Whilst the thoughts of the conscious speak the fear of truth's power.

You are at war within yourself, or so you think. Because conscious is fear, thoughts must be lies so therefore, there is actually no war within you.

There is only giving your conscience the visibility of speaking it's/your truth whilst you listen consciousl.

So, the only way to your inner peace is to accept your life for what it is, with everything that surrounds it, for everything that is in it and for everything that it is, both wonderful and horrible, both nutruring and terrifying. Just as it it 

And then, only when you separate life's unevadable events from your own power and capacity to choose your a positive experience of each and every event thus taking life's tests and learning life's lessons, will you truly be free to live your truth, no matter what is is which makes you happy  

For herein lies faith which is not weakened by a question nor strengthened by an answer

Faith starts with your very own ray of conscience truth emanating from the power of your own sun.

entry.title: BE IN CONTROL OF WHAT YOU DO AND CONTROL HOW YOU DO IT
entry.summary: Often, we have very little control or no control at all over what happens. We do, however have total, or…
entry.content:
Often, we have very little control or no control at all over what happens.

We do, however have total, or almost total control over how we respond to life's happenings.

I have named this Psychological equation E³; Event + Experience = Eventuality.

In other words, events happen but how we choose to experience those events determines, NOT essentially the outcome of the event, but moreso how we have CHOSEN to process the reality of the event.

entry.title: FEAR
entry.summary: "Fear is a projected emotion based on what may be, not what is." Dr J S Greenstein. Constant mental reiteration…
entry.content:
"Fear is a projected emotion based on what may be, not what is." Dr J S Greenstein.

Constant mental reiteration of impending doom and gloom causes us to exist in preperation for the worst, even though the worst has not necessarily occured. Our minds create a possible, perhaps even probable, but nonetheless non-existent outcome of what is occuring in the present. This habitual pattern of thought alignes with related emotions precipitating a physiological response of fight, flight or freeze syndrome.

The repetitive secretion of "unnecessary" secretion of fight, flight or freeze syndrome causes the panic chemistry to reach an unjustified high, thus, in turn, stressing out mind and body.

If the worst does actually occur, you will be so busy coping with the reality of its occurence that you wont need to stress about it occuring, because it's just occured.

So, don't worry about what if, worry about what is.

entry.title: WHAT HAPPENED?!
entry.summary: There is a distinct difference between incident occurence in our lives and how we recall those incidents occuring. Our emotional…
entry.content:
There is a distinct difference between incident occurence in our lives and how we recall those incidents occuring. Our emotional state at the time of incident plays a large part in our choice, albeit subconscious, of how we remember incidents and occurences. Emotions can change towards " what happened" for a number of reasons.

Our conscious recollective memoric area of brain can only recall events with lucid clarity for a relatively compromised period of time. The selected emotion affiliated with an incident, perceived as either positive or negative, can also influence our "elected" recollection. Personality types too play a role specifically relative to incidents precipitating fight, flight or freeze responses.

Bottom line; The event which actually occured is vastly different in reality to our experiential response thereunto.

This is what makes my practice, Psycho-Somatic so profound. Using a unique method of separating event from experience of event allows you to recognize events, specifically those that have bothered you, and replace your historic perception of the past with a new, healthy productive memory.

This by no means implies that we remove or alter the past, we simply re-create the way YOU CHOOSE to revisit the past.

BINGO! New perspective on the past, new lease on the future.
